primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the closed system of death and human impossibility to raise Jesus, thereby defeating the cosmic powers of Sin and Death and opening a new reality for humanity.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the 'Power of God' or 'The Almighty')
tekstueel_bewijs: the recognition of the risen Christ was initiated by God
God has raised his Son from the dead
thou hast taken thy great power and begun to reign
the citadel of Death had been stormed
the victory of life is won

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Angel of the Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: an angel of the Lord came down from heaven
He [God the Father] disarmed the principalities

ontvanger.identificatie: The Disciples / The Hearers / The World
tekstueel_bewijs: so that you and I might say to one another... 'The Lord is risen!'
He goes before us; we will see him

helper.identificatie: The Angel / The Word of God / The Holy Spirit (implied)
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel... rolls the stone of doubt and fear from our hearts
the armies of heaven... followed him

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as a 'hostile, invading Power' and a 'bastion' that human capacity cannot breach.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the disciples from fearful nonentities to bold witnesses.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciples
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is strictly a consequence of the primary program (God's act).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has raised his Son from the dead.
The angel... rolls the stone of doubt and fear from our hearts.
He disarmed the principalities and powers.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The women were not going to Jesus' grave with any sort of expectation.
We cannot seriously imagine that... the disciples would suddenly be transformed.

voorbeelden: We owe it to those first Christian disciples to do our very best to understand.
they felt a longing to have some sort of contact.
I know all the objections... I also know that this is a message that would explain everything.
nothing can ever replace a uniquely loved person [Human lack of power].
the only Power capable of bearing away its standard [God's power].

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) in the face of death, contrasted with God's absolute 'Pouvoir' to act outside human possibility.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (the weak, moralistic Easter sermons) to S2 (the reality of death) to S1 (the cosmic victory of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human faith (~S2), but by a divine invasion (S1) that shatters the power of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is a 'horrible indignity' and 'hostile power'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric, grace-oriented narrative. It explicitly critiques anthropocentric moralism and insists on God as the sole Subject of the Resurrection.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The preacher mocks the idea that 'The Resurrection is the divine inspiration for us... to emulate Jesus.'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is not the acting subject of any of the sentences [in moralistic sermons]... Matthew means for it to strike us with utter... awe.
the citadel of Death had been stormed by the only Power capable of bearing away its standard.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly rejects using the disciples or Jesus as mere moral examples.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The disciples are 'nonentities' who are acted upon by God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'making Easter happen' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: God acts, the world is changed, and then humans respond.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus has beaten down death, routed the hosts of Satan, and driven the enemy into full flight.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (via the Angel/Word) opens eyes that were closed.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Death and Sin are 'Principalities and Powers' that hold humanity captive.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject and humanity as the Receiver of a cosmic victory.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance for an Easter sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in narrative semiotics, consciously avoiding the 'Subject-switch' that turns the Gospel into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'snowy New England' imagery, Greimasian analysis reveals the underlying 'Christus Victor' engine driving the text.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Matthew 28; this analysis focuses on the functional roles God and Man play in the preacher's story.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas allows us to see that the preacher's critique of other sermons is specifically a critique of their 'Actantial' failure (making the disciples the Subject).

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly uses semiotic categories (Subject/Syntax) to make its theological point.
